com.rohitsood.urlybird.client
Class DatabaseDirectClient

java.lang.Object
  com.rohitsood.urlybird.client.AbstractDatabaseClient
      com.rohitsood.urlybird.client.DatabaseDirectClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
DatabaseClient, DBMain
class DatabaseDirectClient
extends AbstractDatabaseClient

Provides direct access to the underlying database file system. No remote calls are made. This serves as a proxy for the Data and RoomBooker class. Most methods delegate calls to the Data class.

Version:
1.1
Author:
Rohit Sood

Constructor Detail

DatabaseDirectClient

DatabaseDirectClient()
Default constructor. Creates a new instance of VMID and Data instance. The unique id is obtained from the super class.

Method Detail

disconnect

public void disconnect()
Description copied from interface: DatabaseClient
Disconnects from the database. For distributed clients and server objects are de-referenced and garbage collected. For local clients, the file system is simply flushed and closed.

See Also:
DatabaseClient.disconnect()

book

public boolean book(java.lang.String recId,
                    java.lang.String maxOccupancy,
                    java.lang.String customerId)
             throws RecordNotFoundException,
                    ValidationException
Description copied from interface: DatabaseClient
Books a room. Validates the availability of record id is available, max occupancy and customer id is valid and the room is not already booked. Also date checks are made for a valid booking to take place.

Specified by:
book in interface DatabaseClient
Specified by:

public int create(java.lang.String[] data)
           throws DuplicateKeyException
Description copied from interface: DBMain
Creates a new record in the database by reusing a deleted entry. Inserts the given data, and returns the record number of the new record.

Parameters:
data - The data record to be created.
Returns:

Throws:

find

public int[] find(java.lang.String[] criteria)
           throws RecordNotFoundException
Description copied from interface: DBMain
Returns an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria. Field n in the database file is described by criteria[n]. A null value in criteria[n] matches any field value. A non-null value in criteria[n] matches any field value that begins with criteria[n]. (For example, "Fred" matches "Fred" or "Freddy".)

Parameters:
criteria - The criteria against which to query the database.
Returns:
Array of record numbers which matched the criteria.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - If no records were found for the criteria.
See Also:
DBMain.find(String[])

isLocked

public boolean isLocked(int recNo)
                 throws RecordNotFoundException
Description copied from interface: DBMain
Determines if a record is currenly locked. Returns true if the record is locked, false otherwise.

Parameters:
recNo - The record number to query for locks.
Returns:
true If the record is locked.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - If the record could not be found.
See Also:
DBMain.isLocked(int)

lock

public void lock(int recNo)
          throws RecordNotFoundException
Description copied from interface: DBMain
Locks a record so that it can only be updated or deleted by this client. If the specified record is already locked, the current thread gives up the CPU and consumes no CPU cycles until the record is unlocked.

Parameters:
recNo - The record number of the record to lock.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - If the record could not be found.
See Also:
DBMain.lock(int)

getVMID

public java.rmi.dgc.VMID getVMID()
Gets the VMID associated with this virtual machine. The VMID is created once and cached as a constant. Calls to this returns the cached VMID

Returns:
The unique VMID.
